comment: This professor cares about the students. He makes sure that you understand the course material and the assignments. He insists on you reading the assignment instructions carefully before asking any clarification about the assignment. But he is always there to work with you. He gave amnesty to the class to help us catch up on our late submissions.

I had professor Miawama for my Intro to Programming (Python). He was very accessible. He had a weekly online live sessions for us to come and interact with him, go over the materials, demonstrate codes, or go over our homework and lab questions. He knew how to explained Python in a way that it was easy to do the labs. He is an awesome teacher!

I took this class in the Spring of 2024. Professor Miawama is extremely nice to the people. Hi is always willing to help you in any aspect and make sure that you succeed in your carrier. If I could, I would have taken him so many times. Thank you professor Miawama.

I took Mr Miawama in the Spring semester of 2024: amazing person, a professor, and a real human. He is a fair grader. Very easy to deal with. Do your part of the course and he will do his part. Thank you professor Miawama.

Professor Miawama is one of the few who genuinely cares about his students' success, offering detailed feedback that helps you improve and understand the material. If you put in genuine effort and stay engaged in this course, you'll not only succeed, but also gain valuable knowledge. His dedication to teaching truly sets him apart.
Cluttered course design, unclear directions contained in many different places, condescending when emailed for clarification.

The class itself is easy and straight to the point and he is very responsive, however he can come off rude in email if there's an error on his part and even when communicating upcoming assignments to the class. There's a group project in this class due at the end of the semester.  Weekly discussions, quizzes, and assignments. Not a tough grader.

Great professor, my only issue is he exclusively uses D2L email, and provides a course schedule that is very inaccurate, he expects you to disregard that and follow the d2l calendar instead. He did provide an extension because of this. He cares about student success and replies fast, and hosts a non mandatory teams meeting weekly. Slight accent
